qas.question: What groups is the USAF rank divided amoung?

answers.text: enlisted airmen, non-commissioned officers, and commissioned officers

qas.question: How are Enlisted promotions in the USAF decided?

answers.text: based on a combination of test scores, years of experience, and selection board approval

qas.question: How are Officer promotions within the USAF decided?

answers.text: based on time-in-grade and a promotion selection board

qas.question: How is a Commissioned Officer's rank shown?

answers.text: designated by bars, oak leaves, a silver eagle, and anywhere from one to four stars

context: USAF rank is divided between <a0_0>enlisted airmen, non-commissioned officers, and commissioned officers<a0_0/>, and ranges from the enlisted Airman Basic (E-1) to the commissioned officer rank of General (O-10). Enlisted promotions are granted <a1_0>based on a combination of test scores, years of experience, and selection board approval<a1_0/> while officer promotions are <a2_0>based on time-in-grade and a promotion selection board<a2_0/>. Promotions among enlisted personnel and non-commissioned officers are generally designated by increasing numbers of insignia chevrons. Commissioned officer rank is <a3_0>designated by bars, oak leaves, a silver eagle, and anywhere from one to four stars<a3_0/> (one to five stars in war-time).[citation needed]
